text: {| class="wikitable floatright" style="font-size: 0.9em;" |+ Asteroids discovered: 1 |- | || 20 May 1996 || |- ! colspan=3 style="font-weight: normal; font-size: smaller; text-align: left; padding: 2px 12px;" | with A. Boattini |} Aldo Di Clemente (born 1948) is an Italian amateur astronomer (active 1996–1997). He has worked as a technician at the Campo Imperatore station of the Osservatorio astronomico di Roma (Astronomical Observatory of Rome) since 1982. His assistance was valuable in conducting the Campo Imperatore Near-Earth Object Survey (CINEOS). The main-belt asteroid 91214 Diclemente, discovered by astronomers Andrea Boattini and Luciano Tesi in 1998, was named in his honour. Naming citation was published on 15 December 2005 (). == References == Category:1948 births Category:20th-century astronomers Category:Discoverers of asteroids Category:Italian astronomers Category:Living people
title: Aldo Di Clemente
